content.serviceInfo: This policy applies to the website available at: oliwiermarkiewicz.pl
content.operator: The operator of the website and the controller of personal data is: Oliwier Markiewicz
content.dataController: The Operator is the Controller of your personal data with respect to the data voluntarily provided on the Website.
content.dataPurposes: The Website processes personal data for the following purposes:
content.dataCollection: The Website collects information about users and their behavior in the following ways:
content.collectionMethod: Through data voluntarily entered in forms, which are then entered into the Operator's systems.

dataProtection.title: 2. Selected data protection methods used by the Operator

content.ssl: Login areas and places where personal data is entered are protected at the transport layer (SSL certificate). This ensures that personal data and login data entered on the site are encrypted on the user's computer and can be read only on the target server.
content.backups: To protect data, the Operator regularly performs backups.
content.updates: An important part of data protection is the regular updating of all software used by the Operator to process personal data, in particular the regular updating of development components.

content.hostingProvider: The Website is hosted (technically maintained) on the servers of the provider: Vercel
content.logs: To ensure technical reliability, the hosting company keeps server‑level logs. The following may be recorded:

logTypes.url: resources identified by URL (addresses of requested resources – pages, files)
logTypes.clientName: name of the client station – identification performed by the HTTP protocol
logTypes.errors: information about errors that occurred during HTTP transactions
logTypes.referer: URL of the page previously visited by the user (referrer link) – if the transition to the Website was made via a link
logTypes.diagnostics: diagnostic information related to the process of self‑ordering services via forms on the site
logTypes.email: information related to the handling of email addressed to the Operator and sent by the Operator

rights.title: 4. Your rights and additional information on how data is used

content.dataRecipients: In certain situations, the Controller has the right to transfer your personal data to other recipients if this is necessary to perform the contract concluded with you or to fulfill obligations incumbent on the Controller. This applies to the following groups of recipients:

recipients.authorized: persons authorized by us, employees and associates who must have access to personal data to perform their duties
recipients.marketing: companies with which the Controller cooperates in the scope of own marketing

content.retention: Your personal data is processed by the Controller no longer than necessary to perform activities related to it, as defined by separate regulations (e.g. accounting). With regard to marketing data, the data will not be processed for longer than 3 years.
content.userRights: You have the right to request from the Controller:

rights.access: access to personal data concerning you

content.objection: You have the right to object to the processing referred to in point 3.2 with respect to the processing of personal data for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, including profiling, whereby the right to object may not be exercised if there are compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override your interests, rights and freedoms, in particular the establishment, exercise or defense of legal claims.
content.complaint: You have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent Data Protection Authority.
content.voluntary: Providing personal data is voluntary, but necessary to operate the Website.
content.automation: Automated decision‑making, including profiling, may be carried out with respect to you in order to provide services under the concluded contract and for the Controller's direct marketing.
content.thirdCountries: Personal data is not transferred to third countries within the meaning of data protection regulations. This means that we do not send it outside the European Union.

content.voluntaryData: The Website collects information voluntarily provided by the user, including personal data, if provided.
content.connectionParams: The Website may save information about connection parameters (time marking, IP address).
content.emailLinking: In some cases, the Website may save information facilitating the linking of data in the form to the email address of the user completing the form. In such cases, the user's email address appears within the URL of the page containing the form.
content.processing: Data provided in the form is processed for the purpose resulting from the function of the specific form, e.g. to carry out a service request or commercial contact, service registration, etc. Each time, the context and description of the form clearly informs what it is used for.

content.behaviorLogging: Information about user behavior on the Website may be logged. These data are used to administer the Website.

content.analytics: The Operator uses statistical analysis of website traffic through Google Analytics (Google Inc., USA). The Operator does not provide the operator of this service with personal data, only anonymized information. The service is based on the use of cookies on the user's end device. Regarding information about user preferences collected by Google's advertising network, the user can view and edit information resulting from cookies using the tool: https://www.google.com/ads/preferences/
content.remarketing: The Operator uses remarketing techniques that allow advertising messages to be tailored to the user's behavior on the site, which may give the impression that the user's personal data is being used to track them, but in practice no personal data is transferred by the Operator to advertisers. The technological condition of such activities is the enabled handling of cookies.
content.facebookPixel: The Operator uses the Facebook pixel. This technology causes the Facebook service (Facebook Inc., USA) to know that a registered person is using the Website. In this case it is based on data for which Facebook itself is the controller; the Operator does not provide any additional personal data to Facebook. The service is based on the use of cookies on the user's end device.
content.heatmaps: The Operator uses a solution that studies user behavior by creating heat maps and recording behavior on the site. This information is anonymized before being sent to the service provider so that they do not know which natural person it concerns. In particular, typed passwords and other personal data are not recorded.
content.automation: The Operator uses a solution that automates the operation of the Website with respect to users, e.g. capable of sending an email to a user after visiting a specific subpage, provided that the user has agreed to receive commercial correspondence from the Operator.
content.profiling: The Operator may use profiling within the meaning of data protection regulations

content.definition: Cookies are IT data, in particular text files, which are stored on the end device of the Website User and are intended for the use of the Website's pages. Cookies usually contain the name of the website they come from, the time they are stored on the end device and a unique number.
content.controller: The entity placing cookies on the end device of the Website User and obtaining access to them is the operator of the Website.
content.purposes: Cookies are used for the following purposes:
content.sessionMaintenance: maintaining the Website User's session (after logging in), thanks to which the user does not have to re‑enter the login and password on each subpage of the Website
content.types: Two basic types of cookies are used within the Website: "session" cookies and "persistent" cookies. "Session" cookies are temporary files that are stored on the User's end device until logging out, leaving the website or turning off the software (web browser). "Persistent" cookies are stored on the User's end device for the time specified in the cookie parameters or until they are deleted by the User.
content.browserSettings: Software for browsing websites (web browser) usually allows cookies to be stored on the User's end device by default. Users of the Website may change the settings in this regard. The web browser allows the deletion of cookies. It is also possible to automatically block cookies. Detailed information on this subject can be found in the help or documentation of the web browser.
content.limitations: Restrictions on the use of cookies may affect some of the functionalities available on the Website's pages.
content.thirdParty: Cookies placed on the User's end device may also be used by entities cooperating with the operator of the Website, in particular this applies to the following companies: Google (Google Inc., USA), Facebook (Facebook Inc., USA), Twitter (Twitter Inc., USA).

cookieManagement.title: 9. Managing cookies – how to give and withdraw consent in practice?

content.disableCookies: If the user does not wish to receive cookies, they can change the browser settings. Please note that disabling cookies necessary for authentication, security and maintaining user preferences may make it difficult or, in extreme cases, impossible to use websites.

items.reply: Or reply to any email with a request to unsubscribe

items.stopMessages: You will stop receiving our messages
items.stopNotifications: You will no longer receive notifications about new materials
items.rejoin: You can rejoin the database at any time
